intro: Alsine erecta, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Alsine erecta is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is known for its ability to thrive in poor, dry conditions.
